page.title: 04QUARRY DISPUTE
page.content: Residents and parish councillors in Swillington are objecting to a proposed extension of the village brickworks. This would bring the quarry within metres of a local housing estate. One councillor said,"Swillington has had enough of dirt and noise.We have a right to breathe fresh air.We have a right to enjoy the Green Belt." The main objections to the proposals are:- 1.Noise, dirt and possible blasting disturbances to housing development. 2.Loss of green belt land which could be used for agriculture. 3.Loss of visual amenity causing a depreciation in the value of nearby houses.
